metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10708 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Apport through 2.20.x. In apport/report.py, Apport sets the ExecutablePath field and it then uses the path to run package specific hooks without protecting against path traversal. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted .crash file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Apport registers itself as the default handler for .crash files so an attacker could trick a user into opening a malicious .crash file and execute arbitrary code as the user. A potential method of hardening apport against these types of attacks is to unregister it as the handler for .crash files.

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.25').
